comments.creator: t8av@yahoo.com
comments.author: t8av@yahoo.com
comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.0; rv:6.0.2) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/6.0.2
Build ID: 20110902133214

Steps to reproduce:

I was trying to save a file from a website (image). A file with the same name already existed in the download directory. The two files are different. Only the name is the same.


Actual results:

Firefox announced me that this file name already exists. If I confirm, the old file will be deleted, even that it is different from the new file. This is also a waste of the user's time - it is very common that file names, especially of images, are identical.


Expected results:

Firefox should make a "file diff" between the new file and the old file. If the files are identical, firefox should announce it. If the files are different, filrefox should rename the new file to something like FILENAME1 FILENAME2, etc'.
